====== Tabli - Env List Command ======


===== About =====
The ''list'' command of the [[..:env:start|env module]] that lists the [[:docs:conf:global|global attributes]]
===== Example =====

By default, the listing shows only the ''internal'', ''user'', ''dotenv'' and ''project'' variables

<unit>
<code bash>
tabli env list

</code>
<console>

key                                value                      origin           description                                        
--------------------------------   ------------------------   --------------   ------------------------------------------------   
conf                                                          Calculated       The path to the conf file                          
default-file-system-tabular-type   csv                        Calculated       The default file extension for tabular data        
env                                DEV                        Os environment   The execution environment                          
home                               /home/admin/opt/tabulify   Calculated       The directory home of the Tabulify installation    
log-level                          WARN                       Os environment   The log level                                      
native-driver                                                 Calculated       Native Drivers Properties                          
passphrase                                                    Calculated       The passphrase                                     
project-home                                                  Calculated       The project home path                              
sqlite-home                        /home/admin/.tabli         Calculated       Sqlite home (Where to store the sqlite database)

</console>
</unit>

===== Syntax =====

<unit>
<code bash>
tabli env list -h
</code>
<console>

Tabli env list
==============

List the configurations


Tip:To have a nice output because a value may be very lengthy, you should set the width of your terminal to a big number (such as 10000)



Examples
--------

 1 - List all `tabli` configurations


    tabli env list *


 2 - List all Home configurations


    tabli env list  *home*


 3 - List all attributes set by OS Environment variables


    tabli env list --type OS




Syntax
------


    tabli env list [options|flags] <name-selector...>


where:


  Arguments:

    <name-selector...>                                      One or more glob selector(s) that will filter the output by the key name


  Options:

    -t,--type <mediaType|mimeType|extensionFile>            The type of the configurations to return ('all, command-line, conf, dotenv, os, runtime, sys' or `all`)


  Global Options:

    -vf,--conf <path>                                       The path to a configuration file

    -e,--env <env>                                          The name of the environment

    -h,--help                                               Print this help

    -l,--log-level <error|warning|tip|info|fine>            Set the log level

    -ns,--not-strict                                        A minor error will not stop the process.

    -odu,--output-data-uri <outputDataUri>                  defines the output data uri for the feedback data (default: console)

    -oo,--output-operation <dataOperation>                  defines the data operations (replace, truncate) on an existing output resource before transfer.

    -oop,--output-transfer-operation <transferOperation>    defines the output transfer operation (insert, update, merge, copy). Default to `copy` for a file system and `insert` for a database.

    -pp,--passphrase <passphrase>                           A passphrase (master password) to decrypt the encrypted vault values

    -ph,--project-home <path>                               The project home (default to the .tabli.yml file directory)

    -v,--version                                            Print version information

</console>
</unit>
